metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7529 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Nginx versions since 0.5.6 up to and including 1.13.2 are vulnerable to integer overflow vulnerability in nginx range filter module resulting into leak of potentially sensitive information triggered by specially crafted request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7529` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.8
nginx-common - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.8
nginx-core - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.8
nginx-extras - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.8
nginx-full - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.8
nginx-light - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.8
nginx-naxsi - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.8
nginx-naxsi-ui - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> from the nginx announcement, the following configuration can be used as a temporary workaround: max_ranges 1;

criterions.comment: nginx package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-1ubuntu3.8').
